contentList.content: Gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Melee and Throwing <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> until the end of your turn, but enemies also have Advantage against you.

When you make your first <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attack</LSTag> on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Melee and Throwing Attack Rolls during this turn, but Attack Rolls against you have Advantage until your next turn.
Affected entity has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LSTag> on Melee and Throwing <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> on their turn, and any Attack Roll against them has Advantage.

You've trained to strike swift and true.

When you land a Critical Hit with your melee or thrown Attack, you roll an extra damage die as well as the normal additional critical dice.

You've trained to strike swift and true.

When you land a Critical Hit with your melee or thrown Attack, you roll two extra damage die as well as the normal additional critical dice.

You've trained to strike swift and true.

When you land a Critical Hit with your melee or thrown Attack, you roll three extra damage die as well as the normal additional critical dice.
Your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Rage</LSTag> will not end this turn.
